segments.text: I can't believe how careless everyone is being in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and the woman is just standing there, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even notice the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the kids, oh the kids are just as bad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're climbing on an unstable stool, reaching for cookies like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to tip over, and the girl is just waiting for a cookie, not a care in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're all in some sort of trance, not noticing the mess they're making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to go in there and clean everything up myself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I know it's not my place, so I'll just watch and hope for the best.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Maybe someone will notice before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
